page.title: 05Shakespeare at Wychnor Park
page.content: Since 1983 Wychnor Park has seen open- air performances of three Shakespearian comedies. Behind the Hall, through the rhododendron wood, there is a natural amphitheatre on a promontory over- looking the Trent and Swarbourne flood plain. Dominating the clearing is an ancient giant oak, which acts as a focus and canopy for the acting area. Thickets on either side give cover for entries and exits. Between them, the ground slopes gently up towards the wood; a space terraced for the performance with straw bales for an audience of 300. Tall scaffolding towers house the lighting and the sound crew. The first production was A MIDSUMMER NIGHT'S DREAM. This was followed by THE MERRY WIVES OF WINDSOR and in 1985 TWELFTH NIGHT. The event is in aid of Alrewas Church funds.
